definition: to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)

sentences.english: None were cancelled or lapsed during the period.
sentences.chinese: 於期內，概無任何購股權遭註銷或作廢。

sentences.english: Enterprise's psychological contract violation does not necessarily lead to negative consumer's post-purchase behaviours.
sentences.chinese: 企業心理契約違背不一定導致負面的消費者購後行爲。

sentences.english: Most of our money goes on fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我們的大部分錢用於購時裝。

sentences.english: The overall quality of experience also had a statistically significant effect on post-consumer behavior.
sentences.chinese: 會員的服務整體評價與購後行爲意向間有顯著相關。

sentences.english: Recombinant human granulocyte stimulating factor (GSF) was bought from Qilu Pharmacy Co. , Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 重組人粒細胞刺激因子購於齊魯製藥有限公司。

sentences.english: Secondly, the customer value determines post-purchase evaluation after impulsive buying.
sentences.chinese: 其二，顧客價值決定了衝動性購買的購後評價。

sentences.english: When a large company gets bought out you wonder about your job.
sentences.chinese: 一家大公司被別人收買購，你自然擔心你的飯碗。

sentences.english: For group discount, letter of introduction from your company is needed.
sentences.chinese: 購團體票憑單位介紹信或團體證明。

sentences.english: If you want to Chuk Yuen Estate to buy lychees, the villagers will take you to lychee Island.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想去竹園村購荔枝，村民就會帶你來到荔枝島。

sentences.english: Please refer to your contract for special accessories.
In addition, some high-income residents have purchased airline tickets, ready to fly abroad.
sentences.chinese: 此外，一些高收入居民紛紛購飛機票，準備飛往國外。

sentences.english: If Ihad got enough money yesterday, I would have bought that tape.
sentences.chinese: 如因我今天錢夠的話，我就購了那盒磁帶了。

sentences.english: He payed his subscription by banker's order.
sentences.chinese: 他用銀行本票支付購股金。

definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
